my eleven I was in Sandy

the John Romita my father's been a

spider-man back in the middle 60s to the
middle 70s and I remember being on the
phone literally on the phone with him
when the towers fell when the tower fell
in the first tower fall and I never
heard my father sound like a child
before that he actually sounded like a
teenager in in anger and frustration
when I told him I was doing a spider-man
issue that was based on that event he
said then no that's insane he can't do
that I said no I know I don't want to do

father for you the first thing he
thought of was don't let it affect you
don't let it kill you the spider-man 36
was a strange thought process in my mind
I would never have imagined doing a
count book that was in reaction to

we were capitalizing on such an awful

early is the I think the late seventies

when either I'd do some work over 35

there's always something about an
individual image that I that brings back
a memory from something else if there's
somebody in the room with me and I'm

somebody it brings back a specific

that's the kind of reaction you got from
